title: Code.org - Sprite Lab Lesson 1
subtitle: Chatting with Sprites
excerpt: Learn how to add backgrounds and sprites, ask users for input, save their responses with variables, and make things happen using events.
content:
Sprite Lab Lesson 1: Chatting with Sprites

  1. In Sprite Lab, click New project + and select Sprite Lab

  2. Rename the project to: L1 Chatting with Sprites

Video

  1. From the Blocks toolbar click on World and drag and snap a set background to block to under the the when run block.

  2. Then change the background to the rainbow

Video

  1. From the Blocks toolbar select Sprites. Then drag and snap a make new sprite at block with the bunny under the world block.

  2. Click the bunny sprite and select the dog. Then click on the yellow block attached at the end of the sprite block to move the sprite onto the first mound in the picture.

Video

  1. In the Blocks toolbar select World and find the prompt user for variable block. Drag this and snap it under the sprite block.

  2. After the words prompt user you should see a block with double quotes. Inside this block type: What is your name?

  3. Then below this after the text for variable click on the three ??? question marks and select Rename this variable

  4. In the pop-up type: player_name

  5. Now click the Run button under the Stage/Canvas. You should see the dog sprite say What is your name? but typing does nothing yet.

Video

  1. In the Blocks toolbar click on Events. Drag a when ??? answered on to the Workspace

  2. Click the ??? and select player_name

  3. In the Blocks toolbar click Sprites. Then drag a [Sprite] say [Hello, world] for 4 [seconds] block and snap it under the when player_name answered block.

  4. Change the sprite to the dog. Change the number 4 to the number 10.

  5. In the Blocks toolbar click Text. Find the double-quotes "" block which looks like it can attach front and back. Drag and drop this block over the Hello, world block. Type: Hi and make sure to include a space after "Hi ".

  6. In the Blocks toolbar click Variables. Find the player_name variable block and snap it after double-quotes Hi block.

  7. Click the Run button, type your name and watch the dog respond.
